summary:
“Camping
 star David Tennant bounces into a room in Beverly Hills, where the rest
 of us are waiting for him. He’s fresh off a...
body:
“Camping star David Tennant bounces into a room in Beverly Hills, where the rest of us are waiting for him. He’s fresh off a cross-country flight from New York Comic-Con —balancing a mug of coffee that’s centimeters away from spilling over—and he’ll be on a plane back to the United Kingdom tomorrow. But in this moment, it’s like I’m suddenly witnessing a long-awaited family reunion. “My brothers!” he cheers when he sees costars Brett Gelman and Arturo Del Puerto, wrapping each of them up in a bear hug.

It’s a near-perfect recreation of a scene that happens in the first episode of HBO’s Camping, which premieres on Sunday, and I wonder if it’s for the benefit of me, the guy who has been tasked with writing about what it’s like to hang out with the guys of Camping. But it quickly becomes obvious that if I wasn’t in the room—occasionally managing to steer the conversation back on track—these dudes would happily sit around gabbing and roasting each other all day.”

‘Getting Lost with the Dudes of HBO’s Camping’

- via GQ Magazine (x)

1....
body:
So I watched the Good Omens trailer and guess what I’m in love with that shit and I want it right fucking now!!!😱😱😱 Reasons?

1. Crowley

2. David Tennant

3. Neil Gaiman

4. Aziraphale x Crowley

summary: BBC America’s ‘DOCTOR WHO’ Featuring the Series’ First Woman Doctor, Regenerated with 48% Growth Over Other Season Premieres!
title: BBC America’s ‘DOCTOR WHO’ Featuring the Series’ First Woman Doctor, Regenerated with 48% Growth Over Other Season Premieres!
body:
BBC America’s ‘DOCTOR WHO’ Featuring the Series’ First Woman Doctor, Regenerated with 48% Growth Over Other Season Premieres!

BBC AMERICA’S new season of Doctor Who, featuring Jodie Whittaker as the Thirteenth and first female Doctor, drew 1.4 million viewers and 658,000 adults ages 25-54 in its 1:45 pm global simulcast premiere. Doctor Who now ranks as the fastest growing drama on TV this year with a +48% increase over the previous season premiere in Nielsen live/same day ratings. The season opener ranked as the #1…

View On WordPress

summary: What is your opinion on Rose Tyler returning to Doctor Who? I have read news that Jodie Whittaker is interested in playing...
question: What is your opinion on Rose Tyler returning to Doctor Who? I have read news that Jodie Whittaker is interested in playing opposite her, as well as Alex. My feelings are mixed! Especially when River Song coming back is a big gay win and we can have Space Wives!
answer:
I have a firm opinion regarding Rose’s return: IT SHOULD TOTALLY HAPPEN!!! 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼

Personally, I’d love to catch up with her story & get some closure. I want it confirmed that she’s alive and happy in her alternate universe with her parents and with Tentoo. What I wouldn’t want is to see her still pining over the Doctor. Like, how pathetic and sad would that be after all this time? BIG NO. 👎🏼 I know a lot of people want to see some kind of Rosex13 romance happen but… Now, here’s where things get a bit controversial— Rose Tyler was straight AF. I know some people will not agree with me, but that’s the tea. Just because Billie Piper says Rose would be into 13 doesn’t make it real to me. Unlike with Clara, Bill, or River who have professed interest in women, Rose gave no indication. Like, Jack was very explicit. Lol IDK This whole ‘after the fact’ stuff is getting old. You have actors and writers saying this stuff anywhere but onscreen and then expecting viewers to be happy with that? From classics like Harry Potter’s Dumbledoor to newer ones like The Good Place’s Eleanor, they’re all gay but never in the story? Nah son. If you take the “people discover their sexuality later or we don’t have to say it to be it” that’s totally valid, and YOU can have it. That’s fine. But it is still bullshit when it comes to representation and I’m not taking it unless they properly serve it up. It’s 20gayteen. 🏳️‍🌈

With that said, Jodie Whittaker, as well as Matt Smith, have said they’d like to work with Billie’s Rose!! Because like hi it’s Rose Tyler!! But it didn’t happen for Smith (the moment wasn’t Rose) and I think there’s a slim chance that it will happen for Whittaker. They always ask the actor playing the Doctor which companion they’d want returning or which monster and it seldom happens. It’s exciting that Jodie said Rose and River, but Old Chibbs stated no old companions or monsters would be returning. I’m guessing he means season 11. So I have a tiny hope! Old Chibbs loves David and has worked with him before. He might bring Rose and Tentoo back?? 🤞🏼

On your big gay win! Would I die if our two Space Wives were dancing around each other onscreen with their big puppy eyes and soft touches? YES. God, Jodie would be a puddle with Alex Kingston. But Chibnall needs to establish his era on his own. Without the ghosts of the past lingering about, and it may take a while until he decides he’s ready for the past to return! With that said, I don’t believe for a second that River didn’t use the TARDIS on Darillium to escape into the future. So, there’s always wiggle room for them.

((But tbh, I’d rather have River Song come back on a rebooted Torchwood than to WHO. Give her a story away from the Doctor please. Thanks.))

Super long post but there’s my op on that. 👌🏼💕

***UPDATE: I was just told that BigFinish has done some Tentoo short stories and I’m LIVING. Apparently Rose and him are alive and well and Tentoo is IN LOVE THE HOUSE. Can you imagine 13 visiting them in the parallel world? WANT.

With that said, Jodie Whittaker, as well as Matt Smith, have said they’d like to work with Billie’s Rose!! Because like hi it’s Rose Tyler!! But it didn’t happen for Smith (the moment wasn’t Rose) and I think there’s a slim chance that it will happen for Whittaker. They always ask the actor playing the Doctor which companion they’d want returning or which monster and it seldom happens. It’s exciting that Jodie said Rose and River, but Old Chibbs stated no old companions or monsters would be returning. I’m guessing he means season 11. So I have a tiny hope! Old Chibbs loves David and has worked with him before. He might bring Rose and Tentoo back?? 🤞🏼

On your big gay win! Would I die if our two Space Wives were dancing around each other onscreen with their big puppy eyes and soft touches? YES. God, Jodie would be a puddle with Alex Kingston. But Chibnall needs to establish his era on his own. Without the ghosts of the past lingering about, and it may take a while until he decides he’s ready for the past to return! With that said, I don’t believe for a second that River didn’t use the TARDIS on Darillium to escape into the future. So, there’s always wiggle room for them.

((But tbh, I’d rather have River Song come back on a rebooted Torchwood than to WHO. Give her a story away from the Doctor please. Thanks.))

Super long post but there’s my op on that. 👌🏼💕

***UPDATE: I was just told that BigFinish has done some Tentoo short stories and I’m LIVING. Apparently Rose and him are alive and well and Tentoo is IN LOVE THE HOUSE. Can you imagine 13 visiting them in the parallel world? WANT.

blog.name: bifrostgiant
blog.title: I say thee nay
blog.description: Hi. Loki blog with other nerd culture themed items scattered about.

tags: just wait for the jon hamm story
title: The Good Omens cast (NYCC 2018)
body:
I was very fortunate to attend a signing with the cast of Good Omens at NYCC (2018).  Being the dork that I am, I wore my Loki costume while meeting Michael Sheen, David Tennant, Neil Gaiman, Jon Hamm, Miranda Richardson and Douglas Mackinnon

They were all very lovely people.  Just look at how happy Michael Sheen was.

This delightful human being literally had a huge grin on his face the entire time.

While I was talking with Sheen, David Tennant leaned over and asked “Do you think Loki’s really dead?”  We then spent a good few minutes chatting about various “Loki is still alive” theories.  And by chatting I mean me talking at him about my favorite “Loki is still alive” theories while he listened politely.  It wasn’t until I was being pushed down the line towards Neil Gaiman (legend) that I realized I didn’t even gush over Tennant like a proper fangirl.  So I shouted, while hovering over poor Neil Gaiman, “I love Doctor Who, and Broadchurch, and Jessica Jones, and you’re amazing!”

Almost as great as me telling Miranda Richardson I liked her hair because I didn’t know what else to say.

Smooth as a super skinny pumpkin latte.
